summary: This is a response cover sheet and certificate of authenticity from AT&T to the FBI, providing phone records in response to a legal demand related to an investigation into child exploitation and human trafficking. The document certifies the authenticity of records being produced for the case.

persons.name: Amanda Young
persons.context: Recipient of the AT&T records, works for the FBI Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force in New York.

persons.name: Tony Rincon
persons.context: AT&T employee who signed the certificate of authenticity for the phone records being provided to the FBI.

connections.description: Rincon, as an AT&T compliance analyst, is certifying and providing records to FBI Special Agent Young in response to a legal demand.

events.title: FBI Legal Demand Issued
events.description: The FBI issued a legal demand to AT&T for phone records, as referenced by the request date on the cover sheet.

events.title: AT&T Certification of Records
events.description: Tony Rincon of AT&T signed a certificate of authenticity for phone records being provided to the FBI in response to their legal demand.

locations: AT&T 11760 US HWY I. SUITE 300 NORTH PALM BEACH FL 33408
26 FEDERAL PLAZA 23RD FLOOR NEW YORK NY 10278-0004
keyFacts: The FBI's Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force, led by SA Amanda Young, was actively seeking phone records from AT&T as part of an investigation in August 2019.
AT&T complied with the legal demand, providing certified records and a cover sheet emphasizing the confidentiality of the information.
The document is a formal certification under Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 902(13), intended for use in legal proceedings.
The case number referenced is 2787395, and the document is part of a larger set (EFTA01264598, EFTA01264599).
